subject: Photography
title: Landscape vs. Portrait Orientation
description: One-minute skill: Landscape vs. Portrait Orientation.

hook.text: Horizontal or vertical? That first decision shapes everything about how your image feels and what it includes.

buildup.text: Landscape (horizontal) orientation emphasizes width: horizons, vistas, panoramas. It feels open and expansive.

discovery.text: Portrait (vertical) orientation emphasizes height: towers, people, waterfalls. It feels intimate and focused.

twist.text: Most people default to landscape because that's how we hold cameras. But half of all subjects deserve vertical.

climax.text: The best photographers shoot both and choose later. Orientation isn't a habit â€” it's a creative decision.

punchline.text: Turn your camera. See a different story.

quiz.question: When is portrait (vertical) orientation typically most effective?
options: For tall subjects and intimate, focused compositions
